title: Life, Sex and Death - The Silent Majority (1992)
description: Life, Sex & Death was a hard rock band that achieved minor success in the early 1990s. They released one major label album in 1992 called The Silent Majority. Two of their songs appeared on the Beavis & Butthead TV Show, "Tank" and "School's For Fools". They were known for the antics of their lead singer Stanley (aka Chris Stann), who dressed in dirty clothes and wandered around the audience before gigs, mumbling incoherently. A popular rumor was that he was a homeless man who the band had recruited to sing.
